description: From Medieval Latin turpethum, from Arabic تُرْبِد‎ (turbid), from Persian تربد‎ (torbed), from Sanskrit त्रिपुटा (tripuṭā), त्रिपुट (tripuṭa), literally “triplicated”, names of several plants.

entries.meaning: Operculina turpethum (obs. syn. Convolvulus turpethum, Ipomea turpethum, Merremia turpethum), a plant in the morning glory family.
(chemistry, obsolete) A heavy yellow powder with chemical formula Hg3O2SO4.
